code: @Manual{,   title = {codename: Generation of Code Names for Organizations, People, Projects, and Whatever Else},   author = {Steve Miller},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.5.0},   url = {https://github.com/svmiller/codename}, }

what: Generation of Code Names for Organizations, People, Projects, and Whatever Else
title: Generation of Code Names for Organizations, People, Projects, and Whatever Else
text: codename allows users create short, pithy code names organizations, work projects, , people, whatever else. core package eponymous codename() function, allows user create various types code names. code names returned function, large, two-word character vector attribute object. Right now, options include “” (default incorporates battery adjectives nouns), “gods” (object name deity saint religion), “ubuntu” (code name alliterative object always animal), ‘nicka’ (code names partly derived conventions spelled old U.S. NICKA system) “wu-tang” (code name derived classic Wu-Tang Name Generator). codename() also features ability use reproducible seeds, including character seeds, maximum transparency reproducibility.

title: Generation of Code Names for Organizations, People, Projects, and Whatever Else
text: can install CRAN. can also install development version package devtools package.

title: Generation of Code Names for Organizations, People, Projects, and Whatever Else
text: isn’t much belabor usage self-explanatory. sample output.
code: library(codename)  # Generate console message about package version. # Successive updates may break the expected output of a reproducible seed. # This just adds some layer of transparency/clarity. codename_message() #> code name generated by {codename} v.0.4.9. R version 4.1.2 (2021-11-01).  # defaults to any codename() #> [1] "burnt red helium" codename() #> [1] "unrealistic half" codename() #> [1] "straight digestive" codename() #> [1] "limited coonskin"  codename(type = "gods") #> [1] "jaunty yahweh" codename(type = "gods") #> [1] "these auseklis" codename(type = "gods") #> [1] "honored chernobog" codename(type = "gods") #> [1] "dark blue grey dagon"  codename(type = "nicka") #> [1] "ill myth" codename(type = "nicka") #> [1] "twin worship" codename(type = "nicka") #> [1] "frivolous barn" codename(type = "nicka") #> [1] "definite metronome"  codename(type = "ubuntu") #> [1] "reflecting rattlesnake" codename(type = "ubuntu") #> [1] "wintergreen weasel" codename(type = "ubuntu") #> [1] "virtuous vole" codename(type = "ubuntu") #> [1] "hoarse hippopotamus"  codename(type = "wu-tang") #> [1] "Mighty Worlock" codename(type = "wu-tang") #> [1] "Mighty Beggar" codename(type = "wu-tang") #> [1] "Violent Commander" codename(type = "wu-tang") #> [1] "Vulgar Lover"  variety_pack(seed = "A Reproducible Character Seed") #> [1] "afraid patriarch" #> [1] "meaty ausrine" #> [1] "xiphoid xenarthra" #> [1] "banana barnacle" #> [1] "Scratchin’ Commander" variety_pack(seed = 8675309) #> [1] "yellow orange twist" #> [1] "scholarly wakan tanka" #> [1] "wavy wear" #> [1] "moss mandrill" #> [1] "Thunderous Wizard"

text: x character vector

title: Convert a character vector to a numeric integer for setting a reproducible seed — char2seed
text: char2seed() takes character vector returns reproducible seed use whatever purpose. used internally codename(). char2seed_v1() , using older method v. 0.1.0 v. 0.2.0 release.

title: Convert a character vector to a numeric integer for setting a reproducible seed — char2seed
text: Interested users can see works. Namely, letters (numbers) character vector assigned corresponding numbers. char2seed(), numbers concatenated together divided 1 minus absolute maximum number R can handle default (2^32). remainder division ultimately becomes reproducible seed. char2seed_v1(), numbers added together exponentiated create really big number. number divided 1 minus absolute maximum number R can handle default (2^32). remainder division ultimately becomes reproducible seed. nature parlor trick means possibility, however small, two different character vectors can return reproducible seed. happened https://github.com/svmiller/codename/issues/1, changed function generating seed moved old function char2seed_v1(). function may warn "loss accuracy", just means supplied really long character vector.

title: Convert a character vector to a numeric integer for setting a reproducible seed — char2seed
text: Steven V. Miller

title: Convert a character vector to a numeric integer for setting a reproducible seed — char2seed
code: char2seed("ABCDEF") #> [1] 123456 char2seed("Go Bucks!") #> [1] 655170768 char2seed("My Project Title") #> [1] 518381568

Generate a unique codename for yourself, your organization, other people, your projects, and whatever else — codename
text: type type code user wants. Defaults "", "gods", "nicka", "ubuntu", "wu-tang" available. seed optional reproducible seed, can specified character number.

title: Generate a unique codename for yourself, your organization, other people, your projects, and whatever else — codename
text: codename() takes preferred type code optional reproducible seed returns codename user consider whatever want.

title: Generate a unique codename for yourself, your organization, other people, your projects, and whatever else — codename
text: type '' (default), function combines adjective data frames together (.e. Wu-Tang set, colors, generic adjectives) combines noun data frames together (.e. animals, generic nouns, gods, Wu-Tang nouns). samples combines together. type 'gods', function randomly samples god gods data frame pastes random color generic adjective. type 'ubuntu', codename derived broadly consistent Ubuntu versions releases. particular way starts sampling animal animals data frame. animal selected, function finds first letter animal matches something adjectives xkcd_colors data sets. However, anything adjective side equation must length one. words, can get "yellow yak" "yellow orange yak" "yellow orange" color two-word modifier. type 'wu-tang', name derived randomly sampling wu_adjs wu_nouns data frames. type 'nicka', function randomly samples U.S. agency nicka_blocks data frame. agency series two-character blocks can draw noun adjective. Thereafter, function randomly selects something compilation adjectives nouns start something two-character block selected, though sampling procedure omits adjective noun one word. can cross-reference code name nicka_blocks data frame see agency representing something sure nefarious may require congressional hearing.

title: Generate a unique codename for yourself, your organization, other people, your projects, and whatever else — codename

title: Generate a unique codename for yourself, your organization, other people, your projects, and whatever else — codename
code: codename() #> [1] "warm brown dynamo" codename(type = "ubuntu") #> [1] "punctual python" codename(type = "gods") #> [1] "previous ausrine" codename(type = "wu-tang") #> [1] "Amateur Destroyer" codename(type = "nicka") #> [1] "high cultivar" codename(type = "ubuntu", seed = "A Character Seed") #> [1] "butter bug" codename(type = "gods", seed = "A Character Seed") #> [1] "vengeful brigit" codename(type = "wu-tang", seed = "A Character Seed") #> [1] "Irate Ninja" codename(type = "nicka", seed = "A Character Seed") #> [1] "seafoam paint"

title: codename 0.5.0
text: codename_message() now display version R user well. add greater transparency event R changes seed generator . Added nicka_blocks future use.

title: codename 0.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-09-07 Ensure adjectives starting capital letters can matched animal names. Thank @lemna pointing fixing . Add adjectives animals starting x (HT: @lemna).

title: codename 0.3.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-06-24 Change char2seed() function move old version char2seed_v1(). affect codename(), beyond seed supplied output.

title: codename 0.2.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-05-10 Add codename_message() display package version console. may matter future updates alter underlying data, can change output reproducible seed. Add variety_pack() function sampling wares, (optional) reproducible seed. Remove “list” animals. function copy-pasting list found somewhere, just copy-pasted scraped without lot inspection output. Fix “chantio” “chantico” gods. bad. Scrub documentation instances “codename” “code name.” former works well function package name, “code name” proper English. don’t think anyone notice care. Force “” options lowercase. Basically, inclusion Wu-Tang names results mismatch. codename permit title case Wu-Tang name generator component package. Add set.seed(NULL) top line codename(). Basically, R’s set.seed() designed top-level script. means run seed , path pre-determined afterward code name generation follows path. Configure website pkgdown.

title: codename 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-04-14 Initial developmental release
